org.glassfish.gmbal
Interface ManagedObjectManager

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Closeable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ManagedObjectManagerInternal
All Known Implementing Classes:
ManagedObjectManagerImpl, ManagedObjectManagerNOPImpl
public interface ManagedObjectManager
extends java.io.Closeable

An interface used to managed Open MBeans created from annotated objects. This is mostly a facade over MBeanServer.

Nested Class Summary
static class ManagedObjectManager.RegistrationDebugLevel
          DebugLevel used to control how much debug info is printed for registration of objects.

Method Detail

suspendJMXRegistration

void suspendJMXRegistration()
If called, no MBeans created after this call will be registered with the JMX MBeanServer until resumeJMXRegistration is called.

resumeJMXRegistration

void resumeJMXRegistration()
Causes all MBeans created since a previous call to suspendJMXRegistration to be registered with the JMX MBeanServer. After this call, all new MBean registration calls to the JMX MBeanServer happen within the register call.

createRoot

javax.management.NotificationEmitter createRoot()
Create a default root MBean. One of the createRoot methods must be called before any of the registration methods may be called. Only one call to createRoot is permitted after an ManagedObjectManager is created.

Returns:

createRoot

javax.management.NotificationEmitter createRoot(java.lang.Object root,
                                                java.lang.String name)
Create a root MBean from root with the given name. One of the createRoot methods must be called before any of the registration methods may be called. Only one call to createRoot is permitted after an ManagedObjectManager is created.

register

javax.management.NotificationEmitter register(java.lang.Object parent,
                                              java.lang.Object obj,
                                              java.lang.String name)
Construct an Open Mean for obj according to its annotations, and register it with domain getDomain() and the appropriate ObjectName. The MBeanServer from setMBeanServer (or its default) is used. Here parent is considered to contain obj, and this containment is represented by the construction of the ObjectName.

The ObjectName is constructed with name/value pairs in the following order:

  1. The rest of the parent (that is, everything in the parent except for the type and name values)
  2. The value "[typevalue]=[namevalue]" where typevalue is the value of the type pair in the parent, and namevalue is the value of the name pair of the parent (if any; parent may be null).
  3. "[typeword]=[type]", where typeword is either "type" or "j2eeType", and type is derived from the @ManagedObject annotation of obj (note that the class of obj, or one of its superclasses or superinterfaces, must be annotated with @ManagedObject or an error results).
  4. "name=[name]",

Parameters:
parent - The parent object that contains obj.
obj - The managed object we are registering.
name - The name to use for registering this object.
Returns:
The NotificationEmitter that can be used to register NotificationListeners against the registered MBean. Only AttributeChangeNotifications are supported.

register

javax.management.NotificationEmitter register(java.lang.Object parent,
                                              java.lang.Object obj)
Same as register( Object, Object, String ), but here the name is derived from an @ObjectKeyName annotation.

Parameters:
parent - The parent object that contains obj.
obj - The managed object we are registering.
Returns:
The NotificationEmitter that can be used to register NotificationListeners against the registered MBean. Only AttributeChangeNotifications are supported.

registerAtRoot

javax.management.NotificationEmitter registerAtRoot(java.lang.Object obj,
                                                    java.lang.String name)
Registers the MBean for obj at the root MBean for the ObjectManager, using the given name.

Parameters:
obj - The object for which we construct and register an MBean.
name - The name of the MBean.
Returns:
A NotificationEmitter for this MBean.

registerAtRoot

javax.management.NotificationEmitter registerAtRoot(java.lang.Object obj)
Same as registerAtRoot( Object, String ), but here the name is derived from an @ObjectKeyName annotation.

Parameters:
obj - The managed object we are registering.
Returns:
The NotificationEmitter that can be used to register NotificationListeners against the registered MBean. Only AttributeChangeNotifications are supported.

unregister

void unregister(java.lang.Object obj)
Unregister the Open MBean corresponding to obj from the mbean server.

Parameters:
obj - The object originally passed to a register method.

getObjectName

javax.management.ObjectName getObjectName(java.lang.Object obj)
Get the ObjectName for the given object (which must have been registered via a register call).

Parameters:
obj - The object originally passed to a register call.
Returns:
The ObjectName used to register the MBean.

getObject

java.lang.Object getObject(javax.management.ObjectName oname)
Get the Object that was registered with the given ObjectName. Note that getObject and getObjectName are inverse operations.

Parameters:
oname - The ObjectName used to register the object.
Returns:
The Object passed to the register call.

stripPrefix

void stripPrefix(java.lang.String... str)
Add a type prefix to strip from type names, to shorten the names for a better presentation to the user.

Parameters:
str - Class package name to strip from type name

getDomain

java.lang.String getDomain()
Return the domain name that was used when this ManagedObjectManager was created.

Returns:
Get the domain name for this ManagedObjectManager.

setMBeanServer

void setMBeanServer(javax.management.MBeanServer server)
Set the MBeanServer to which all MBeans using this interface are published. The default value is java.lang.management.ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer().

Parameters:
server - The MBeanServer to set as the MBeanServer for this ManagedObjectManager.

getMBeanServer

javax.management.MBeanServer getMBeanServer()
Get the current MBeanServer.

Returns:
The current MBeanServer, either the default, or the value passed to setMBeanServer.

setResourceBundle

void setResourceBundle(java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
Set the ResourceBundle to use for getting localized descriptions. If not set, the description is the value in the annotation.

Parameters:
rb - The resource bundle to use. May be null.

getResourceBundle

java.util.ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
Get the resource bundle (if any) set by setResourceBundle.

Returns:
The resource bundle set by setResourceBundle: may be null.

addAnnotation

void addAnnotation(java.lang.reflect.AnnotatedElement element,
                   java.lang.annotation.Annotation annotation)
Method to add an annotation to an element that cannot be modified. This is typically needed when dealing with an implementation of an interface that is part of a standardized API, and so the interface cannot be annotated by modifiying the source code. In some cases the implementation of the interface also cannot be inherited, because the implementation is generated by a standardized code generator. Another possibility is that there are several different implementations of the standardized interface, and it is undesirable to annotate each implementation with @InheritedAttributes.

Parameters:
element - The annotated element (class or method for our purposes).
annotation - The annotation we wish to add to the element.

setRegistrationDebug

void setRegistrationDebug(ManagedObjectManager.RegistrationDebugLevel level)
Print debug output to System.out.

Parameters:
level - NONE is no debugging at all, NORMAL traces high-level construction of skeletons and type converters, and dumps results of new skeletons and type converters, FINE traces everything in great detail. The tracing is done with INFO-level logger calls. The logger name is that package name (org.glassfish.gmbal.impl).

setRuntimeDebug

void setRuntimeDebug(boolean flag)
Enable generation of debug log at INFO level for runtime MBean operations to the org.glassfish.gmbal.impl logger.

Parameters:
flag - true to enable runtime debug, false to disable.

dumpSkeleton

java.lang.String dumpSkeleton(java.lang.Object obj)
Dump the skeleton used in the implementation of the MBean for obj. Obj must be currently registered.

Parameters:
obj - The registered object whose skeleton should be displayed.
Returns:
The string representation of the skeleton.
